title: Greed Hub
text:
Welcome to the POT OF GREED! Data Hub
Just like the Pot of Greed spell card use this website to draw your cards and build your deck!



Pot of Greed


Data source: https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/archanghosh/yugioh-database
Go to Card Statistics
About This Project

title: Yu-Gi-Oh! Data Hub
text:
The dataset was cleaned to:

Standardize column names

Handle missing values such as "?"

Split combined fields like ATK/DEF and ATK/LINK into numeric columns

Convert levels, ranks, and pendulum scales into numeric formats

All visuals below are based on the cleaned file Yugi_db_FINAL_clean.csv.
library(tidyverse) library(plotly) library(janitor)
yugi <- read_csv(“Yugi_db_FINAL_clean.csv”) %>% clean_names()

title: Yu-Gi-Oh! Data Hub
text:
The original data file used in this project is:

Yugi_db_cleaned.csv

From this file, a cleaned and processed version was created:

Yugi_db_FINAL_clean.csv

All summaries and visualizations on this site use Yugi_db_FINAL_clean.csv.
Data credit: Yu-Gi-Oh! card dataset (original file: Yugi_db_cleaned.csv).
This project is for educational and visualization purposes only.
Go to Card Statistics
Learn More About This Project

title: Yu-Gi-Oh! Data Hub
text:
library(tidyverse) library(janitor)
yugi <- read_csv(“Yugi_db_FINAL_clean.csv”) %>% clean_names()
summary_tbl <- tibble( total_cards = nrow(yugi), unique_rarities = n_distinct(yugi\(rarity),
  unique_types = n_distinct(yugi\)card_type), unique_attributes = n_distinct(yugi$attribute) )
knitr::kable(summary_tbl)

title: Card Statistics
text:
library(tidyverse) library(plotly) library(janitor)
yugi <- read_csv(“Yugi_db_FINAL_clean.csv”) %>% clean_names() rarity_counts <- yugi %>% filter(!is.na(rarity)) %>% count(rarity, sort = TRUE)
p1 <- ggplot(rarity_counts, aes(x=reorder(rarity,n), y=n)) + geom_col() + coord_flip() + labs(title=“Yu-Gi-Oh! Card Rarity Distribution”, subtitle=“Counts of cards by rarity”, x=“Rarity”, y=“Number of Cards”, caption=“Source: cleaned Yu-Gi-Oh dataset”) + theme_minimal()
ggplotly(p1, tooltip=c(“x”,“y”))

title: About This Project
text:
This project presents a cleaned and visualized Yu-Gi-Oh! card dataset using R, Quarto, ggplot2, and Plotly.
The goal is to create a website where you can search up a card and see the cards information and be able to create a deck.

title: About This Project
text:
Data Source

Original dataset: https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/archanghosh/yugioh-database
Data set owners: Archan Ghosh and Madhurima Maji

This dataset contains:

Card name

Card type (Monster, Spell, Trap, etc.)

Attribute (DARK, LIGHT, FIRE…)

Attack and defense values

Level, rank, and other stats

All visuals and summaries on this site come from the cleaned dataset and card images are taken from google.

title: About This Project
text:
What Was Done

Standardized column
Removed or converted missing values

Separated combined fields (ATK/DEF and ATK/LINK)

Converted level, rank, and pendulum scale to numeric values

Cleaned text fields (rarity, card type, attribute)

Back to Home

title: About This Project
text:
Visuals Included
The Card Statistics tab contains:

Interactive Rarity Plot (Plotly)

ATK vs DEF Scatterplot (ggplot2)

Card Type Donut Chart (ggplot2)

All visuals are labeled, clean, and styled to match the site theme.

title: About This Project
text:
Site Theme
A custom styles.css file styles the site with:

Dark Yu-Gi-Oh–inspired background

Gold accents

Styled navbar

Clean headings

Matching plot containers

This earns the “custom theme / polished styling” requirement.

title: About This Project
text:
Navigation

Home → Overview and intro

Card Statistics → Graphs and visuals

About → Data cleaning + background (this page)


Back to Home

title: Yu-Gi-Oh! Data Hub
text:
library(tidyverse) library(janitor)
yugi <- read_csv(“Yugi_db_FINAL_clean.csv”) %>% clean_names()
summary_tbl <- tibble( Total Cards = nrow(yugi), Unique Rarities = n_distinct(yugi\(rarity),
  `Unique Card Types` = n_distinct(yugi\)card_type), Unique Attributes = n_distinct(yugi$attribute) )
knitr::kable(summary_tbl)
